restlib.data

Class MediaRange

  • java.lang.Object
    • restlib.data.MediaRange
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Matcheable<MediaRange>

    @Immutable
public final class MediaRange
extends Object
implements Matcheable<MediaRange>
    Represents an Internet Media Type (also known as a MIME Type or Content Type). This class also supports the concept of media ranges defined by HTTP/1.1.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static MediaRange ANY
      The wildcard MediaRange "*/*" that matches any MediaRange.

    • Field Detail

      • ANY

        public static final MediaRange ANY
        The wildcard MediaRange "*/*" that matches any MediaRange.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static MediaRange create(String type,
                String subtype)
        Returns a new MediaRange with the given type and subtype .
        Parameters:
        type - a non-null HTTP token.
        subtype - a non-null HTTP token.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if type, subtype is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if type or subtype are not valid HTTP tokens.

      • create

        public static MediaRange create(String type,
                String subtype,
                Charset charset)
        Returns a new MediaRange with the given type, subtype and charset.
        Parameters:
        type - a non-null HTTP token.
        subtype - a non-null HTTP token.
        charset - any non-null Charset instance except Charset.ANY.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if type, subtype, charset is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if type or subtype are not valid HTTP tokens or are wildcards, or if charset is equal to Charset.ANY.

      • create

        public static MediaRange create(String type,
                String subtype,
                Charset charset,
                Multimap<String,String> parameters)
        Returns a new MediaRange with the given type, subtype, charset, and parameters.
        Parameters:
        type - a non-null HTTP token.
        subtype - a non-null HTTP token.
        charset - any non-null Charset instance except Charset.ANY.
        parameters - a multimap of non-null HTTP tokens to HTTP words, where no key is case-insensitively equal to the strings "q" or "charset".
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if type, subtype, charset, or parameters are null. Also if parameters contains any null keys or values.
        IllegalArgumentException - if type or subtype are not valid HTTP tokens or are wildcards, or if charset is equal to Charset.ANY, or if any key in parameters is a not a valid HTTP token, or if any value in parameters is not a valid HTTP word, or if any key is case-insensitively equals to the strings "q" or "charset".

      • create

        public static MediaRange create(String type,
                String subtype,
                Multimap<String,String> parameters)
        Returns a new MediaRange with the given type, subtype and parameters.
        Parameters:
        type - a non-null HTTP token.
        subtype - a non-null HTTP token.
        parameters - a multimap of non-null HTTP tokens to HTTP words, where no key is case-insensitively equal to the strings "q" or "charset".
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if type, subtype, or parameters are null. Also if parameters contains any null keys or values.
        IllegalArgumentException - if type or subtype are not valid HTTP tokens or are wildcards, or if any key in parameters is a not a valid HTTP token, or if any value in parameters is not a valid HTTP word, or if any key is case-insensitively equals to the strings "q" or "charset".

      • parse

        public static MediaRange parse(String mediaRange)
        Parses a MediaRange from its String representation.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if mediaRange is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if mediaRange is not parseable.

      • match

        public int match(MediaRange that)
        Description copied from interface: Matcheable
        Defines the quality of the match of this to that. For instance, for a MediaRange this text/* would match any that text/ MediaRange, however text/html would not match text/*
        Specified by:
        match in interface Matcheable<MediaRange>
        Returns:
        The quality of the match. 0 is no match, 1000 is an exact match. Values in between are defined by the implementation.

      • parameters

        public Multimap<String,String> parameters()
        Returns a multimap containing the parameters of this media type.

        public String subtype()
        Returns the media subtype.

      • type

        public String type()

      • withCharset

        public MediaRange withCharset(Charset charset)
        Returns a new instance with the same type and subtype as this instance, with the charset parameter
        Parameters:
        charset - any non-null Charset instance except Charset.ANY.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if charset is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if charset equals Charset.ANY.
        IllegalStateException - if either the type or subtype of the media range are wildcards.
